intro: Eriocaulon filamentosum, commonly known as the filamentous flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
